name: tutoring
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
tutor
to teach a child outside of school, especially in order to give the child extra help with a subject he or she finds difficult: Oscar tutors our son in maths.

More examplesFewer examplesHer parents decided to have her tutored.His maths skills were weak, so she tutored him over the summer.Eventually his parents removed him from school and tutored him at home.He was born into a wealthy Hungarian family and was tutored privately.
